answers.answer: Well, it's been a couple of days now, so if it's getting better, then maybe you can just talk about it at your next regular appointment, but if it's not better or getting worse, then maybe you should go ahead and make an appointment.  Sorry for the delayed response.  I really don't know what this is.  You're not on anticoagulants, are you?

question: I have heart disease and diabetes. About a week ago a large bruise started appearing on my left knee and it is tender to the touch. The bruise has since gotten more prominent. I have type 2 diabetes and I have had two heart attacks so I have about 6 stents now. What do you think this is and can I wait a couple of days before going to the doctor?
title: large bruise on left knee
